summary.title: Initial State Preparation for Quantum Chemistry on Quantum Computers
summary.description: This paper addresses the critical problem of preparing high-quality initial states for quantum algorithms that estimate ground-state energies in quantum chemistry.

sections.title: A novel quantum algorithm
comments: The algorithm is well-explained, and the improvement over prior approaches is significant.

sections.title: The energy distribution framework
comments: This section could be more detailed, but the concept of assessing initial state quality without knowing the true ground state is novel and valuable.

sections.title: Quantum refining methods
comments: The discussion of coarse QPE with post-selection is clear, but some readers may find the terminology complex.

sections.title: The concept of 'Goldilocks problems'
comments: This section could be more developed, but the idea of identifying optimal candidates for quantum advantage is intriguing.

sections.title: Numerical demonstrations
comments: The examples are well-chosen and help illustrate the benefits of improved initial states, but some readers may find the results too focused on transition metals.
